AI Archaeologist

Analyze artifacts and uncover historical context using AI.

View on GitHub

AI Archaeologist

This is a full-stack web application that goes beyond simple image classification to provide rich, multi-layered analysis of historical artifacts. Upload a photo of an artifact, and the system predicts what it is, its era, material, significance, and even nearby archaeological sites.

I am currently focusing on:

  • Artifact classification using a fine-tuned EfficientNetV2 model trained on 9 South Asian artifact classes (alloy, bead jewellery, blackstone, Kendi, Thakli, hunting tool, pottery, shell bangle, vatta_sillu).
  • Contextual enrichment using a knowledge base to provide detailed historical and cultural context.
  • Time & space calculations: Carbon-14 dating + geospatial awareness with the Haversine formula to show nearby sites.
  • Automated PDF report generation with images, charts, and contextual information.

Future updates will include enhanced multi-artifact support, improved contextual descriptions, and interactive visualizations.

The goal of this project is to augment human expertise, making archaeology more accessible and bridging the gap between AI predictions and historical understanding.
